text: Rokas Žilinskas (20 July 1972 – 6 June 2017) was a Lithuanian journalist and politician. He was elected to the Seimas in 2008 and was a member of the Lithuanian Parliament until his death. He was the first openly gay member of the parliament. Žilinskas died of respiratory arrest caused by pneumonia in Vilnius, Lithuania on 6 June 2017 at the age of 44. ==References== Category:1972 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from respiratory arrest Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Members of the Seimas Category:Journalists Category:LGBT politicians Category:Gay men Category:LGBT writers
title: Rokas Žilinskas
